intro: Agalinis rigida, commonly known as rigid agalinis, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and typically grows in moist, open habitats such as prairies and woodland edges. The plant features slender, erect stems and produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, with a rough texture. Agalinis rigida is often found in disturbed soils and can serve as an indicator species for certain ecological conditions.
